location.name: entrance
location.item:
The book appears to be a journal of some kind - you read some of the most recent entries:
27th - I have decide to explore the dungeons of the long dead wizard, in search of the great treasure rumoured to be found in there.
...
28th - I have received some useful advice, from an old adventurer who once tried to explore the wizard's lair. She told me of a cursed level - every item and offering there brings nothing but misery and harm, except for one single blessing.
...
30th - Today I set out on my quest, confident that I will soon be rewarded for my efforts with the great riches to be found!

location.name: level_1
location.item:
This is a small book, containing some notes. The writing is barely legible, and gets worse towards the end. You read some of the entries:
I don't know how long I have been kept here, locked up in this tiny cell.

scenery.name: Chest
scenery.item: This book seems to be a record of unfortunate prisoners that were kept in this terrible place:

npc.name: Calbert
npc.opening_initial: My goodness, how wonderful to have a visitor! It has been a long time since I have had any kind of company down here.
npc.opening_interaction_complete: Thank you once again for helping me. Once I have finished researching from this book that you found for me, I will finally be able to leave this place.
npc.talk: I am Calbert, a scholar, employed by the great wizard to help in his research here.

talk.question: Don't you know the wizard is long dead? It's been one hundred years...

npc.talk: No, surely not ... that is terrible news if he has died, admittedly I haven't seen him in a while. But one hundred years? It's been a while, but surely not more than a few months...

The wizard had set me a research task, but grew impatient at my lack of progress - he cast a spell trapping me in this room, to remain until I had completed my task. Unfortuately the answers do not lie in these books, and I am now unable to leave. Perhaps you could help me? All I need is some information on necromancy, maybe there is some resource of the subject matter you are able to bring me...

talk.question: I have a book that may help you

npc.talk: Ah, thank you! Yes that looks like it will be of most help to me.

scenery.name: Chest
scenery.item: This is a vial of some murky green liquid, though you are unsure of its effect.

scenery.name: Trapdoor
scenery.confirm_text: There is a trapdoor in this room. Do you want to drop down into the room below?

talk.question: Prepare to die, you evil creature!

scenery.name: Cabinet
scenery.item: I have discovered an amazing secret! ...

npc.name: Peasant
npc.opening_initial: How amazing to once again have visitors through the gate! I hope you are not like those who travelled here before...

talk.question: There have been earlier visitors through the gate?

npc.talk: Yes, and still they remain. I was just a child when it happened, almost forty years ago. Evil creatures of the like that we have never seen before. They burned down our homes and took what little wealth we had, before forcing us to build them a lair. Now they come back to the village once a year, to take captives - who knows for what dreadful purpose.
If you really want to go there, they live in a dug out cave to the north. Though I do not recommend it.

talk.question: How can I get back through the gate?

npc.talk: I don't know that. We know of nothing of how such powerful magic works - just that there seems to be no way to use it.

scenery.name: Crate
scenery.item: A complex piece of machinery. You wonder if this is the essential piece missing from the teleporter.
This book appears to be a journal kept by ...

npc.name: Peasant
npc.talk: I am a peasant from the nearby village, but I was captured by the Goblins attacking our village, and brought back here, where I have been kept prisoner ever since.

npc.name: Peasant
npc.talk: I am a peasant from the nearby village, but I was captured by the Goblins attacking our village, and brought back here, where I have been kept prisoner ever since.

npc.name: Peasant
npc.talk: I am a peasant from the nearby village, but I was captured by the Goblins attacking our village, and brought back here, where I have been kept prisoner ever since.
